alert.note: Alert for Bell; Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 4:59PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Bell and southeastern Knox Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 459 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Trosper, or near Barbourville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Flat Lick and Old Flat Lick around 505 PM EDT. Ingram and Davisburg around 510 PM EDT. Fourmile around 515 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Clear Creek Springs, Wallsend, Pineville, Wasioto, Straight Creek, Cary, Arjay, Blanche, Rella, East Pineville, Ferndale, Meldrum, Binghamtown, Ponza, Calvin, Kettle Island, Varilla, Miracle, Hutch and Callaway. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
